thread.title: Why an Internet activist refuses to take down Patreon breach data
thread.title_full: Why an Internet activist refuses to take down Patreon breach data - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Sean Sposito
title: Why an Internet activist refuses to take down Patreon breach data
text:
Photo: Michael Macor, The Chronicle Patreon staff work at the company’s San Francisco office last year. The crowdfunding platform for artists was hacked this month. Patreon staff work at the company’s San Francisco office last...
Earlier this month, Patreon, a San Francisco startup that lets artists solicit funds from the public, fell victim to a breach that released roughly 15 gigabytes of password data, donation records and source code — potentially exposing its users and their backers to unforeseen risk. Patreon staff work at the company’s San Francisco office last year. The crowdfunding platform for artists was hacked this month. Patreon staff work at the company’s San Francisco office last...
Earlier this month, Patreon, a San Francisco startup that lets artists solicit funds from the public, fell victim to a breach that released roughly 15 gigabytes of password data, donation records and source code — potentially exposing its users and their backers to unforeseen risk.
